column4: hey can anyone help me out with how to deselect packages marked for install
in synaptic?  or what?
well i was using apt-get
new to ubuntu
I don't understand your problem then.  You had something installed and now you want to remove it? or what?
by accident i did apt-get install b43*, it said a bunch of stuff is marked for install, will this stuff get installed on like a apt-get upgrade?
i was looking for the fc equivilant like yum search b43*
did you hit 'n' to cancel it?  you want apt-cache search [stuff],  but, why not use synaptic?
sudo apt-get -s update, will simulate, so you can double check that it wont
er, upgrade.  update refreshes your package.litss
it said that there were broken packages and ended, would i have to confirm before any install?
but it still said a bunch of packages were selected
ill run the simulation
ok so it said 0 for everything, that means nothing will be installed right ? :)
uh, I don't know what '0 for everything' means, but sounds like it, yes.
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 0 to remove and 0 not upgraded.
aye.  Looks good.
Glorious!
Thanks for your help, always paranoid im gonna bloat a new install with my stupidity
well, if its a fresh install, you can always reinstall.  But yeah, check synaptic out.
thanks!
